newsitem.title: USA: U.S. weekly hog/corn, steer/corn ratio -- USDA. [CORRECTED 22:26 GMT]
newsitem.headline: U.S. weekly hog/corn, steer/corn ratio -- USDA. [CORRECTED 22:26 GMT]

text.p: The U.S. hog/corn ratio for the week ended Dec 3 was 22.6 versus 21.6 in the previous week and 13.7 in the corresponding week a year ago, the U.S. Agriculture Department said Wednesday.
The steer/corn ratio in the week was 27.5 versus 26.0 in the previous week and 20.8 in the year-ago week.
The ratio represents the number of bushels of corn that can be bought at Omaha for 100 lbs of hog or steer.
(USDA corrects all figures in report) (c) Reuters Limited 1996
